entry.title: SAP For Purchasing
entry.content:
Good Morning,

I have recently been workforce reduced, AGAIN. That's twice in 17 months.

As I seek new opportunities I am being asked about my SAP experience and usage.

Since 1990 I have learned and used multiple computerized inventory softwares.

What makes SAP any better than other programs? Is it more useful? What are the benefits? How is it used in purchasing? Are there visual examples I can access to see how it is used in purchasing.

If anyone does respond, please be straightforward with plain talk.

Thank You.

entry.title: Free Online Info Session for Students & Professors in Ukraine
entry.content:
Kickstart Your Career in the SAP Ecosystem!
 
Date&time: Thur, Oct, 9, 2025, 3-4:30 pm (Kyiv time)
Duration: 1.5 hours
Language: English (with Q&A)
Format: Virtual
Presenter: Tsovinar Chugaszyan, SAP Champion & Campus Ambassador.
Introduction: Anna Mikulytska, Managing Director, SAP Ukraine.
 
Description:
 
Ever wondered how global companies run their most critical operations ‚Äî from finance to logistics, HR to supply chain ‚Äî using advanced technologies? This free info session offers a fast-paced and motivational introduction to the world of SAP, Europe‚Äôs largest tech company and the global leader in business process management.
 
Designed for both students and professors, the session condenses the essentials of SAP into an inspiring journey: how it powers the world‚Äôs biggest companies, the career opportunities it opens, and how you can start learning ‚Äî completely free.
 
What you will gain:
 
üåçA global perspective: Understand SAP‚Äôs role in shaping the way Fortune 500 companies operate.
üöÄCareer inspiration: Discover career paths in the SAP ecosystem, from Business Analyst to Developer, Functional Consultant, and more.
üéìFree training & certification: Learn how to access SAP‚Äôs global learning hub (worth ‚Ç¨1400) at no cost and earn an official SAP certification ‚Äî a global career passport.
üé≤Learning through play: Experience interactive opportunities like the Business Builders Game (HEC Montr√©al) and open SAP lectures from leading international universities.
 
Who should join:
 
Students from any discipline interested in combining business and technology for international careers.
 
Professors looking to enrich their teaching, become SAP Educators, connect students with global opportunities, and build international academic collaborations.
 
Why attend?
 
This is more than a tech session ‚Äî it‚Äôs a career launchpad. Whether you want to contribute to Ukraine‚Äôs digital future or explore what Europe‚Äôs #1 enterprise tech company is all about, this session is your first step.
 
Link coming soon.

entry.title: Re: Pro-code UI Extension in SAP Sales and Service Cloud V2
entry.content: The app router handles the authentication between your custom service and the mashup as well as the oath flow. Client SDK takes care about authentication between the custom service and SSCv2 as SSCv2 requires a different token than the custom service.

entry.title: Revised items automatically reassigned when first completed via a Program.
entry.content:
Can I assign items to new users via a Program using an assignment profile, and ensure that if any item is revised later, it gets automatically reassigned to those users?
The initial completion must happen through the Program, and users should not see both the Program and the individual items in their Learning Plan at the same time.

entry.title: In SAP S/4 Hana Public Cloud for the OSS (One Stop Shop) report - Portugal
entry.content:
Dear colleagues,

We are looking for a report or application in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud that allows us to generate the data required for the EU OSS (One Stop Shop) VAT return. The ‚ÄúVAT One Stop Shop Return‚Äù application is not available to Portugal.

Does anyone know of an alternative or approach to extract the relevant data (e.g., by tax code, destination country, net value, tax amount, etc.) for the OSS return‚Äîwhether through standard applications, custom CDS views, or any other tools?

Thank you.

Fabiane Melo

var select = Source_Obj.getSelections();
console.log(select);

for (var i=0; i<select.length; i++) {

Thanks in advance...

entry.title: Validation in Draft with State Messages in RAP
entry.content:
When we build applications using the ABAP RESTful Application Programming Model (RAP), one of the big advantages is the ability to work with draft-enabled business objects. Draft handling lets users edit data, save it temporarily, and only activate it when they‚Äôre ready. 

But here‚Äôs the catch: even in draft mode, we can‚Äôt allow just anything to be saved. Business rules still need to be checked. This is where validations with state messages come in. They ensure data quality while giving users clear, contextual feedback right inside the Fiori UI. 

In this post, I‚Äôll Walk you through how to set up such validations in RAP. 

Why do we need validations in draft? 

We need validation in a draft to maintain data integrity and consistency throughout the business process by identifying inconsistencies early, providing immediate feedback to the user, and ensuring that data meets business requirements before it becomes active, thereby preventing errors and improving the overall reliability of the system.   

  • Ensures Data Integrity: Validation checks if data entered into a draft is consistent with predefined criteria, preventing the storage of incomplete or incorrect data.  
  • Provides Immediate Feedback: Users receive real-time messages indicating any inconsistencies or issues within the draft, allowing them to correct them before committing to the final active state.  
  • Supports Data Consistency Validations are triggered at predefined points in the transaction cycle, ensuring that draft instances remain in a consistent and reliable state.  
  • Prevents Business Errors: By catching errors in the draft stage, validation prevents them from propagating to the active data, avoiding costly mistakes and ensuring the accuracy of final data.  
  • Enhances User Experience: Users are informed about missing or incorrect information, allowing them to modify their input without needing to complete the entire transaction to see the problem.  
  • Facilitates Data Reliability: For developers, this means the data that eventually leaves an API can be trusted because it has been validated, leading to simpler and more reliable front-end code. 

Validation: 

A validation is an optional part of the business object behavior that checks the consistency of business object instances based on trigger conditions. 

A validation is implicitly invoked by the business object‚Äôs framework if the trigger condition of the validation is fulfilled. Trigger conditions can be modify operations and modified fields. The trigger condition is evaluated at the trigger time, a predefined point during the BO runtime. An invoked validation can reject inconsistent instance data from being saved by passing the keys of failed instances to the corresponding table in the FAILED structure. Additionally, a validation can return messages to the consumer by passing them to the corresponding table in the REPORTED structure. 

Points to be noted: 

When working with validations, you have to consider the following runtime specifics: 

  • In unmanaged scenarios, validations are only supported for draft instances, not for active instances. 
  • The execution order of validations is not fixed. If there is more than one validation triggered by the same condition, you cannot know which validation is executed first. 
  • It is not allowed to use EML modify statements in validations. 
  • In a managed scenario with draft, it is strongly recommended to assign validations to the PREPARE, so that state messages from the validations are returned correctly to the consumer. 

Messages in RAP: 

State Messages: 

  • State messages refer to a business object instance and its values. 
  • State messages must be always bound to a business object instance. 
  • You mustn‚Äôt define state messages in an action or function added on projection level(Dump). 
  • Draft Scenario, They‚Äôre persisted until the state that caused the message is changed. 
  • Managed scenario, the messages are buffered until the end of the session. 
  • If a validation returns an error message regarding an incorrect value in a field, 
  • The state message persisted until the value is changed and the save sequence is  Triggered again. 
  • Using State messages is only recommended for the following cases: 
  • Business object with draft capabilities: Determinations and validation that are  
  • Allocated to the prepare or a determine action. 
  • Unmanaged Business Object: Finalize/check before save code exit. 
  • Managed Scenario: Determination/validation on save. 

Transition Messages: 

  • Refers to the current Request. 
  • It can either be bound or unbound (not related to business object instances). 
      APPEND VALUE #( %tky = <ls_keys>-%tky
                     %msg = NEW /dmo/cm_flight_messages(
                        textid   = /dmo/cm_flight_messages=>discount_invalid
                        severity = if_abap_behv_message=>severity-error
      )                 %element-bookingfee = if_abap_behv=>mk-on
                       %action-deductdiscount =  if_abap_behv=>mk-on )
                       TO reported-zr_travel_d1.
        APPEND VALUE #( %msg      = new_message_with_text(
                        severity = if_abap_behv_message=>severity-error
                        text = 'operation not authorized!' ) )
                        TO reported-zr_travel_d1.
    APPEND VALUE #(
            %tky                = booking-%tky
            %state_area         = 'VALIDATE_CUSTOMER'
            %msg                = NEW /dmo/cm_flight_messages( textid   = /dmo/cm_flight_messages=>enter_customer_id
                                                               severity = if_abap_behv_message=>severity-error )
            %path               = VALUE #( zR_Travel_D1-%tky = travel_booking_links[
                                                                   KEY id
                                                                   source-%tky = booking-%tky ]-target-%tky )
            %element-CustomerID = if_abap_behv=>mk-on )
               TO reported-zr_booking_d1.
  • Trigger condition can be: CUD operation or modified fields(Update for validation is only  Supported in combination with create). 
 validation validateCustomer on save { create; field CustomerID; }

Trigger Time: 

  • Validation on save are executed: 
  • In the check Before save method of the save sequence. 
  • On request by executing a determine action, if the validation has been assigned to 
  • Such an action in the behavior definition. For more information, see Determine Actions. 

For making the validation you have to make field as mandatory. 

field ( mandatory ) CustomerID; 

validation validateCustomer on save { create; field CustomerID;} 

  • Give implementation for validatecustomer method in local handler class. 
  • When we are working with state messages in RAP first we need to invalidate it without msg and later 
  • If needed, we can validate with msg. 
      APPEND VALUE #( %tky        = travel-%tky
                      %state_area = 'VALIDATE_CUSTOMER' )
             TO reported-zr_travel_d1.
  • Adding back with msg: 
  • If we remove state area it will become transaction message. 
      IF travel-CustomerID IS INITIAL.
        APPEND VALUE #( %tky = travel-%tky ) TO failed-zr_travel_d1.

        APPEND VALUE #( %tky                = travel-%tky
                        %state_area         = 'VALIDATE_CUSTOMER'
                        %msg                = NEW /dmo/cm_flight_messages(
                                                      textid   = /dmo/cm_flight_messages=>enter_customer_id
                                                      severity = if_abap_behv_message=>severity-error )
                        %element-CustomerID = if_abap_behv=>mk-on )
               TO reported-zr_travel_d1.

On Fiori app: 

Here we can see Customerid is 1 and it‚Äôs a valid value so it will not through any error  

Message whenever user click enter or save button. 

Now I will edit it and pass some invalid value. See how it behaves. 

@Consumption.valueHelpDefinition: [{entity: {name: '/DMO/I_Customer_StdVH', element: 'CustomerID' }, useForValidation: true }] 

Here am not using use for validation : true that‚Äôs why if user click on enter it will not throw any error message it will only throw error message when  User click on save button. 

Now i have added use for validation: true. 

See it will validate when user click on enter as well. 

These messages are coming from read after performing  modify. 

As we are reading from parent entity travel for booking. 

Here are minor changes in validation from travel customer validation. 

Apart from this most of the things are similar. 

%path is different and link data. 

    READ ENTITIES OF zR_Travel_D1 IN LOCAL MODE
         ENTITY zr_booking_d1
         FIELDS ( CustomerID )
         WITH CORRESPONDING #( keys )
         RESULT DATA(bookings).
    READ ENTITIES OF zR_Travel_D1 IN LOCAL MODE
         ENTITY zr_booking_d1 BY \_Travel1
         FROM CORRESPONDING #( bookings )
         LINK DATA(travel_booking_links).
            %path               = VALUE #( zR_Travel_D1-%tky = travel_booking_links[
                                                                   KEY id
                                                                   source-%tky = booking-%tky ]-target-%tky )
            %element-CustomerID = if_abap_behv=>mk-on )
               TO reported-zr_booking_d1.

For Booking: 

Am not using here this annotation so here it's not validating at frontend with enter. 

It will validate once user click on save button. 

I will pass incorrect value for custoimerid. 

See what happen: 

It is accepting while click on enter. 

It is giving error only after press save button. 

Even if customerid is mandatory field it will accept empty value when we hit enter 

It will validate only after click on save button. 

For Booking Supplement 

Here am not passing any value and if we click on save button validation will be  

Trigger and throw a error message as Enter a ProductID. 

If ProductID it is wrong, it will throw error message as ProductID is unknown. 

 

 

Things needs to define: 

In behavior definition: 

field ( mandatory ) SupplementID;
  validation validateSupplement on save { create; field SupplementID; }

In local handler class 

Here we need to link both parent and child as it is grandchild entity. 

    READ ENTITIES OF zR_Travel_D1 IN LOCAL MODE
         ENTITY ZR_BookingSupplement_D1 BY \_Booking1
         FROM CORRESPONDING #( bookingsupplements )
         LINK DATA(booksuppl_booking_links).
    READ ENTITIES OF zR_Travel_D1 IN LOCAL MODE
         ENTITY ZR_BookingSupplement_D1 BY \_Travel1
         FROM CORRESPONDING #( bookingsupplements )
         LINK DATA(booksuppl_travel_links).
            %path                 = VALUE #(
                zr_booking_d1-%tky = booksuppl_booking_links[ KEY id
                                                             source-%tky = <bookingsupplement>-%tky ]-target-%tky
                zR_Travel_D1-%tky  = booksuppl_travel_links[  KEY id
                                                            source-%tky = <bookingsupplement>-%tky ]-target-%tky )
            %element-SupplementID = if_abap_behv=>mk-on )
               TO reported-zr_bookingsupplement_d1.

These highlighted lines such as path are different from travel and booking entity as this is a type  

Of grandchild entity. So we have to link with both entity parent such as travel and child such as booking. 

            %path               = VALUE #(
                zR_Travel_D1-%tky = travel_booking_links[ KEY id
                                                          source-%tky = booking-%tky ]-target-%tky )
            %element-CustomerID = if_abap_behv=>mk-on )
               TO reported-zr_booking_d1.

entry.title: SM37 Page Limits - Pulling data from SM37 spool with over 100,000 Pages
entry.content:
We have jobs that have as many as 250,000 pages. We currently have to download to .txt format by batches of 4,000.

Settings for spool -> pages 1 to 4000 -> Save list in file: text with Tabs -> ____.txt

Settings for spool -> pages 4000 to 4001 -> Save list in file: text with Tabs -> ____.txt

How can the page limit be increased without causing the error TSV_TNEW_PAGE_ALLOC_FAILED ?

Alternatively, is there a more efficient way to pull all of the data to .txt at once, or a different approach altogether?

entry.title: S/4HANA transition for US Federal Agencies
entry.content:
Introduction

In SAP ECC, the solution designed for US federal agencies relies on the Public Sector Management (PSM) component and special ledger functionality. Extensions to PSM were introduced to support federal-specific processes and reporting requirements, such as the Global Treasury Accounting Symbols (GTAS). GTAS are identification codes that classify financial transactions for the US federal government, consisting of a three-digit agency identifier, a period of fund availability, and a main account specifying the fund‚Äôs purpose.

A key feature for public sector entities in SAP ECC is the use of special purpose ledgers. Ledger 95 is specifically reserved for handling US federal government transactions and maintains the split processor configuration. Together with Ledgers 96 and 97, it manages budgetary information and postings for federal accounting requirements. Because this functionality exists only through special ledgers in ECC, most federal agencies remained on classic G/L without the ability to migrate to parallel ledgers in New G/L.

In SAP S/4HANA, the universal journal replaces the special ledger functionality, with the additional information from Ledgers 95, 96, and 97 available as federal ledgers in ACDOCA. This shift creates a significant migration challenge: federal agencies running on ECC cannot pursue brownfield conversions as it cannot bring the information in special ledgers to the universal journal. Meanwhile, greenfield implementations require major investments of time and budget, and they do not support migration of detailed historical transactional data‚Äîoften a regulatory requirement. Thus, neither brownfield nor greenfield options are viable.

Objective

The objective is to design a unique solution that meets the data migration needs of US federal agencies transitioning from ECC to S/4HANA. This solution must be able to extract splitting information from ECC special ledgers and apply it to the universal journal in S/4HANA, enabling migration of complete historical transactional data while ensuring business continuity and minimal change management.

Solution

SAP‚Äôs Data Management and Landscape Transformation (DMLT) organization has extended its Selective Data Transition (SDT) solution to specifically address the needs of US federal agencies. Often referred to as the ‚Äúthird option,‚Äù SDT provides an alternative to the traditional brownfield and greenfield approaches. It combines the strengths of both, offering flexibility in choosing the balance between reuse and redesign during S/4HANA transitions.

SDT leverages SAP DMLT‚Äôs proprietary software to design and execute tailor-made transitions. The key principle is separating application data from metadata (configuration, organizational structure, customizations, custom code, add-ons, etc.). The metadata is first used to create an S/4HANA shell, which can be deployed in a FedRAMP-authorized cloud environment.

During shell creation, federal-specific extensions such as the federal ledger, budgetary ledger, BCS, and budget period are configured. Once complete, the shell is ready to receive application data from the legacy ECC system.

For historical data migration, SDT tools have been extended to read selective history from ECC special ledgers and map it to the universal journal in S/4HANA. This allows complete transfer of historic transactional data, while ensuring alignment with redesigned federal-specific objects (e.g., mapping ECC tables FMUS* to S/4HANA tables PSGL*).

Note: Prior to data migration, the federal ledger and general ledger must be reconciled to ensure consistency.

Beyond federal extensions, SDT provides additional capabilities such as time-slicing historical data, harmonizing chart of accounts, and executing Customer-Vendor Integration (CVI) on the fly. Since the migration involves direct database loads, throughput is very high and optimized for large data volumes. SDT also includes advanced monitoring, error handling, and automated data validation, ensuring both efficiency and accuracy.

This approach is currently the only SAP-supported method for migrating historical transactional data from ECC to S/4HANA for US federal agencies.

Conclusion

SAP‚Äôs Selective Data Transition (SDT) offers a repeatable, automated, and secure solution for migrating historical transactional data from ECC to S/4HANA.

Key highlights of this solution include:

  • A hybrid approach that blends brownfield (reuse) and greenfield (redesign) strategies.
  • Extended SDT tools tailored for US federal agency requirements‚Äîthe only SAP solution that enables historical transactional data migration.
  • Compatibility with FedRAMP-authorized cloud environments.
  • Mapping of special ledgers (95, 96, 97) to the universal journal in S/4HANA.
  • Direct database load approach ensuring maximum business continuity and minimal change management.
  • Ability to selectively migrate historical data and apply business-specific transformations on the fly.
  • A structured deployment process involving at least three iterative rounds of migration and validation before production cutover.

This solution, available through SAP services, has already been successfully deployed and being deployed at multiple US federal agencies, enabling compliance, efficiency, and business continuity in their transition to S/4HANA.

 

SAP S/4HANA #USFed #DMLT #SDT

entry.title: Re: Why is BOM Header Not Transferred to Project in Auto...
entry.content:
If your VC model is complete you do not need a PS Project to feed MRP requirements, that will come from the Sales Order requirement.  MRP will explode the BOM and handle all the lower level requirements.

There are other options depending on your business situation.

You can do a BOM transfer for lower level components if you need to order them immediately before the top level component is complete.  You can use Preliminary Requirements to prevent double ordering.

When you are ready to order the final VC material you can manually add it to the project and the same Configuration screen will pop up.  MRP will then explode this BOM and "consume" the preliminary requirements.

Technically you can also use BOM transfer for just the top level material (I'm not exactly sure how this would work if it is a Configurable material), but that's no different than adding it manually.

entry.title: New Developer- and SAP-Technology Forums/Groups
entry.content:
Dear "Application Development and Automation" group members/subscribers, 

In case you haven't seen the general announcement post that went out earlier this week, this blog post is to inform you that we launched a pilot of new developer- and SAP-technology related forums/groups this week.

For you, this means that while the pilot runs, the "Application Development and Automation" group is set to read-only.
We would like to encourage you to go to our new developer forums/groups, if you would like to ask or answer questions, or publish blog posts, on development/technology-related topics. 

There are a number of different reasons why we would like to test these new forums/groups: 

  1. Since our platform migration last year, we have received feedback that you didn't know where to go to find topics like ABAP, Integration or UI5. With these new developer forums/groups, we hope we have made it easier for you to find the technology topics you are most interested in.

  2. We noticed that the discussion board in this group was used to ask development related-questions. Generally, everyone has been very helpful answering questions asked here. However, our interest groups are for having conversations with, and connecting to, like-minded people around shared interests. This is why these groups have discussion boards (= for conversations) and blog posts, instead of Q&As/forums. Therefore, when someone asks a question in the "Application Development and Automation" discussion board, it is not possible for the author to accept the right answer as a solution. This again means, that if someone with the same problem comes to the community to get help later on, they will not be able to see what the solution to the problem was.
    Which brings us to no. 3 below:

  3. Because answers to questions in discussion (conversation) boards won't have accepted solutions, we are also not able to give credit to, or celebrate, the members who took the time to help answer questions.

  4. With the new developer forums, authors can accept any answer as a correct solution, which means we will be able to bring back our topic expert leaderboards, and give proper credit to our members who answer questions.

  5. A new denser forum feed, with no preview of content, making it easier to scroll down the feed to look for the questions you can help answer: 


  6. New filter for "Questions with no answers". 
    This long-requested filter has now been added to all new Developers forums, so that you can find all questions with. no answers on a specific topic with one click: 
  7. We can now highlight important product announcements, or other valuable content, you shouldn't miss, around your favourite development topics by using the "Featured Topics" section for the individual topics.

  8. Better subscription management.
    You will now be able to subscribe to either all developer/SAP-technology related content, or drill down to and only subscribe to the specific parts that interest you the most:
    1. Developers https://community.sap.com/t5/developers/ct-p/developers - here you can subscribe to the whole category, this subscription sends you notifications on the platform and email notifications according to your account settings. 
    2. The individual groups, with both the Forums and Blog posts - here taking ABAP Cloud as an example: https://community.sap.com/t5/abap-cloud/gh-p/abap-cloud - here you have the same subscribe option as above. If you subscribe to content here, it will send you notifications on the platform and email notifications according to your account settings. 
    3. The individual group boards, ABAP Cloud Forum: https://community.sap.com/t5/abap-cloud-forum/bd-p/abap-cloudforum-board - here you have both the option to Subscribe and Subscribe to RSS Feed. The Subscribe option is the same as the two options above, and the RSS Feed is the one you are looking for. 
      You will find the same options for the blog posts boards as well: https://community.sap.com/t5/abap-cloud-blog-posts/bg-p/abap-cloudblog-board


If you missed the main announcement post, you can find more information in this What's New blog post. 

We hope you hop over to the new Developer groups to try them out üôÇ 
If you have any feedback to us on the forums, you can provide it in the comments section on the What's New post linked above.

entry.title: Re: Exporting Plan Data from SAC to SAP S/4HANA
entry.content:
@Sotiris_X 

Export from SAC to ACDOCP in S4 is always in Overwrite mode. The plan data scope (or deletion scope) defines the plan data record set that will be reversed (overwritten) by the exported plan data record. Existing plan data in the SAP S/4HANA or S/4HANA Cloud system that contains any combination of the values of these dimensions will be reversed (overwritten) before the exported data is posted. You can control what data will be deleted by defining the plan data scope. You can refer to the below to understand how plan data scope can be used to control what data gets reversed before SAC data is loaded to S4.

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_ON-PREMISE/48f4b4785b8e45938ac44a67be8032d9/dd1d244504d44d928d3da20f710a7bd1.html

Hope this helps !!

Nikhil

entry.title: Re: Excluding Down Payments from CO Value Type 12 on WBS...
entry.content:
Why SAP Posts Down Payments to CO is because, SAP Project System (PS) is tightly integrated with CO. Any financial transaction on a WBS element (including down payments) is mirrored in CO to maintain a complete picture of project-related commitments and liquidity. Value type 12 (down payments): This is a statistical posting in CO. It doesn‚Äôt affect actual costs but ensures visibility for project reporting, budget checks, and cash flow analysis.

Why You See the Error (FI660) is because, when you omit customizing in OKEP (default cost elements) and KANK (number ranges for CO documents), the system cannot generate the required CO line item. SAP enforces this because every FI posting to a WBS must have a CO counterpart, even if only statistical.

So the Key takeaway is the note is ‚Äúvalid‚Äù for S/4HANA in terms of documentation, but the correction instructions are obsolete because the fix is already embedded in your release. That‚Äôs why you can‚Äôt implement it, and why SAP still enforces the CO posting logic for down payments.

So to conclude, the only supported workaround remains:

  • Maintain a dummy cost element in OKEP/KANK for KAZO.
  • Exclude that cost element (or value type 12) from your reporting and budget checks.

entry.title: Re: Why asset doest not have material code in SAP ERP?
entry.content:
Hello @nithin_pranesh 

What‚Äôs standard in S/4HANA Public Cloud (J62)? J62 covers the integrated asset acquisition process with purchasing; the asset master exists before GR, allowing GR/IR and invoice to link to the correct asset, which is how the J62 test flow is written

SAP‚Äôs External Asset Acquisitions describes the PO/invoice-integrated acquisition options; enrichment of the asset master is handled in Manage Fixed Assets afterwards. SAP Help Portal-External Asset Acquisitions

SAP KBA guidance for J62 prerequisites transfer date, etc confirms that the Public Cloud process is guided by the J62 setup, rather than by a ‚Äúcreate at GR‚Äù switch. Currently, there is no documented setting to delay the automatic creation of GR.  SAP Support Portal-3119457 - Not able to create asset using the Manage Fixed Asset app - SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

Why serial and technical details often come later. Serial numbers and equipment can be created or assigned during Goods Receipt, after which those technical objects are linked to the asset. That‚Äôs why detailed identifiers are usually added after the PO. Learn SAP Dermo-How to Create Serial Numbers using a Goods Receipt

Bottom line confirmed. In Public Cloud with J62, the planned process is that the asset exists by the time you post GR and invoice; you then enrich missing fields later to manage the Fixed Assets equipment link. There is no SAP-documented option in Public Cloud to transfer the automatic asset creation from PO to GR.

Let me know if you need further support

With kind regards

Chuma

Nesse caso, as f√©rias podem abranger at√© 01/03. Com essa atualiza√ß√£o, a provis√£o necess√°ria para o terceiro m√™s tamb√©m √© realizada.

entry.title: Re: Incorrect Creation Time Displayed in Billing Document...
entry.content:
Why the time mismatch occurs is because, SAP internally stores timestamps in UTC (Coordinated Universal Time). When you view a document in VF03, SAP converts this UTC time to your local time using the time zone settings configured in the system. If the time zone settings in your user profile or system configuration are incorrect or misaligned, the displayed time will not match your actual local time. This issue is not user-specific because the system-wide time zone configuration (application server or client settings) affects all users.

Areas to check

In SU01, under Default tab, check what time zone is maintained. Ensure, it reflects your local time zone.

Go to transaction STZAC to check the system time zone configuration. The system time zone should match the location of your SAP application server or be aligned with your business requirement.

Finally, refer to SAP Note 741734 for guidance on correcting time zone inconsistencies. Also review SAP Notes 481835 and 101726 for deeper analysis of UTC timer and time zone settings.

entry.title: SAP Business One in Peru: Questions on Licensing, RUC and Support
entry.content:
Good morning everyone,

I have several questions regarding the operation and licensing of SAP Business One in the Peruvian context, both at an accounting and contractual level.

Change of RUC and business name
If I acquire SAP Business One registered under a specific business name and RUC (Unique Taxpayer Registry), what happens if I later deactivate that RUC and business name? Is it possible to migrate all the information and licenses to a new business name and RUC, while keeping the same legal owner?

Support and maintenance
I stopped paying for SAP support and maintenance for almost 5 years. When I tried to regularize the situation with my partner, I was told that I was subject to a ‚Äúlifetime‚Äù contract, despite not having used the system for the last 2 years. Is there any way to recover the licenses and be able to reinstall/migrate the system, considering that I need to change the hardware due to equipment failure?

Licenses as assets
I understand that SAP licenses are considered assets. Is it possible to sell, transfer, or move them to another company or individual?

I greatly appreciate any guidance, experience, or regulatory reference you can share, especially if you have gone through a similar case in Peru.

Best regards,
Marko

entry.title: Re: Unable to set user-defined currency type as a functio...
entry.content:
You cannot use a user-defined currency type (like Z1) as a functional currency in SAP because functional currency must be an FI-relevant currency type predefined by SAP, such as 10, 30, or 60 and that is why, you were getting the error FINS_ACDOC_CUST237. SAP only allows predefined currency types (like 10 = company code currency, 30 = group currency, 60 = global currency) to be used as functional currencies. User-defined currency types (Z) are considered freely defined currencies*, and SAP does not treat them as valid for FI postings or functional currency roles.

Having said that one option is stick with currency types 10, 30, or 60 for functional currency setup. If you need Z1 for reporting or analytics, you can still use it as a freely defined currency in the ledger ‚Äî just not as the functional currency.

If your goal is to report in a different currency (e.g., USD for an INR company), use currency type 30 or 60 and configure the ledger to include that currency. For analytics, you can use Z1 in Universal Journal (ACDOCA) as a freely defined currency and build reports on it.

Dear Expert,

An employee has a basic wage type 1000 in Infotype 0008 with an amount of 30,000. He was on Leave Without Pay  (Action) for 10 days (11‚Äì15, 21‚Äì25) and therefore remained inactive during this period. After the factoring and storage process in the schema, the wage type 1000 amount is reduced to 20,322.58, which is working correctly.

The issue arises with the PF wage type 1101 in Infotype 0014. The PF is expected to be calculated as a percentage (e.g., 20%) of the employee‚Äôs factored basic pay. However, the system is not considering the factored basic (20,322.58) for the calculation.

Payroll Schema

Z023 - (storing the basic salary after factoring)

The factored basic salary is not being stored in BVER. I believe this is the issue, as the value cannot be read 

ZREC - ( PF calculation rule)

If I use the code mentioned below, only the amounts for Basic01 and Basic02 are read; it does not work for general employees.

AMT+E 1000 - 9,677.42
AMT+R 1000 - 5,806.45 

 

The PF should be calculated as 20% of 20,322.58 = 4,064.52, but this adjustment is currently missing.

Kindly review and suggest a solution.

@sikindar_a

entry.title: Re: CAT2 is showing error message
entry.content:
Hello @Anas71 

For S/4HANA Public Cloud, please note that CAT2/KP26 are not available. The KL001 code generally indicates that the cost center‚Äìactivity type master is missing for the current fiscal year.

To fix this, create or extend TMOD‚Üî1020001 in Manage Activity Types set for 2025 and update the 2025 price in Maintain Activity Price. Afterwards, test with Post Direct Activity Allocation. Also, verify that the cost center category allows activity allocation and that CO periods are open. If problems persist.You can raise an incident with all relevant details to SAP.

You can watch this useful SAP VIDEO SAP Help Financial Planning-Coster Center Activity Cost Rate Calculation-Video

SAP KBA 2864151 ‚Äì Cost Center Category for Activity Types in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition  Why it is necessary for the cost center category to allow activity allocation.

SAP KBA 3108513 ‚Äì CR091 error when inputting activity type into Work Center This isn't your exact message, but it includes important checks on activity types, CC assignments, and their validity.

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Extensibility in the Age of AI: Why ABCD Is Easier (and Smarter) Than You Think
entry.content:
The CTO‚Äôs Concern

Not long ago, during a client conversation, a CTO expressed a concern that resonated deeply:

‚ÄúWe need to extend our system. But every time someone says ‚Äòlet‚Äôs customize this,‚Äô I feel we‚Äôre piling risk. And now with AI coming, I‚Äôm afraid our mess gets worse.‚Äù

That statement captures the heart of a challenge many SAP customers face. Customization has been both the strength and the Achilles‚Äô heel of enterprise landscapes. It allows us to adapt, innovate, and differentiate ‚Äî but it often comes with technical debt, upgrade pain, and hidden complexity.

Why Extensibility Matters More in the AI Era

Let‚Äôs pause here. Ten years ago, if you added a Z-table or tweaked a user exit, the worst-case scenario was some testing pain during an upgrade. Today?

  • If your data model is inconsistent, your AI forecasts won‚Äôt align with reality.
  • If your logic is buried in old exits, Joule copilots can‚Äôt ‚Äúsee‚Äù your processes.
  • If your core is brittle, cloud updates feel like risks, not opportunities.

In other words: extensibility is no longer just about ‚Äúmaking it work.‚Äù It‚Äôs about making AI possible.

And now, with SAP‚Äôs AI ambitions accelerating ‚Äî embedded copilots, Joule agents, and business data clouds powering predictive intelligence ‚Äî the messy customizations of the past risk becoming blockers for the future.

This is where ABCD extensibility comes in. Far from being abstract jargon, it‚Äôs a practical compass to guide enterprises on how to extend the system smartly, safely, and in a way that enables AI instead of hindering it.

The ABCD Levels: A Human Explanation

SAP‚Äôs ABCD framework doesn‚Äôt exist to confuse us ‚Äî it exists to help customers navigate the grey space between innovation and stability.

Here‚Äôs the official breakdown, with real-world translation:

A Short Story: The MV45AFZZ Debate

Anyone who has worked in SAP Sales and Distribution knows the legendary include MV45AFZZ. For decades, it‚Äôs been the go-to spot for developers to implement custom sales order checks, validations, and logic.

At one client, a senior developer proudly said, ‚ÄúWe‚Äôve been using MV45AFZZ for 15 years, and it works just fine. Why change?‚Äù

And he wasn‚Äôt wrong. In many ways, that‚Äôs a Level B extensibility choice: small, controlled, and serving the business well. (In fact, SAP even documented this in SAP Note 3578329, proving that not all ‚Äòold-school‚Äô practices are bad.)

The problem comes when dozens of such exits pile up, undocumented, with overlapping logic ‚Äî and suddenly the system feels like a house of cards.

Here‚Äôs the twist: ABCD extensibility is not about banning MV45AFZZ or exits. It‚Äôs about putting them in the right place, with the right intent.

The IDoc Question: Clean or Not?

One of the most common debates I hear is: ‚ÄúWe use IDocs everywhere. Are they clean core?‚Äù

The answer: Yes, IDocs are safe ‚Äî they fall under Level B.

SAP clarified this in the IDoc Clean Core blog.

Why? Because IDocs are:

  • Officially documented.
  • Supported by SAP.
  • Used for integration and still relevant in S/4HANA.

That said, if you‚Äôre starting a greenfield cloud project, you may want to move toward APIs and Event Mesh (Level A) instead. But if you‚Äôve got an existing landscape with IDocs, don‚Äôt panic ‚Äî they‚Äôre not ‚Äúunclean.‚Äù

Real-World Scenarios: Which Level to Choose?

Why This Matters for AI

AI copilots like Joule don‚Äôt ‚Äúguess.‚Äù They rely on:

  • Stable APIs (Level A).
  • Clear data models (A & B).
  • Trusted logic (not buried in Level C/D).

If your system is full of Level D hacks, AI copilots won‚Äôt understand your processes. But if you steer toward A and B (with C monitored), you create an AI-ready enterprise.

 Closing Thought

Extensibility is not the villain. Misuse is.

The ABCD framework gives us a shared language:

  • A when we want innovation + AI without worry.
  • B when proven frameworks like IDocs or MV45AFZZ still serve us.
  • C only if there‚Äôs no choice ‚Äî and we track it closely.
  • D only if we want to leave a headache for the next generation.

So next time someone says ‚Äúlet‚Äôs customize,‚Äù you don‚Äôt need to panic. You just need to ask:

Is this A, B, C, or D? And that one question can mean the difference between a system that blocks AI ‚Äî and one that accelerates it.

#SAPCleanCore #SAPExtensibility #ABAPCloud #SAPAI #SAPBTP #S4HANACloud #IDoc

entry.title: Urgent Purchasing with Purchase Requisition Workflow in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud-1
entry.content:
Introduction:

In the world of procurement, speed can sometimes matter as much as compliance. Purchase Requisitions (PRs) are great for capturing business needs, but let‚Äôs be honest‚Äîthere are moments when waiting for the usual approval cycle simply isn‚Äôt an option. Perhaps it‚Äôs a critical spare part, or maybe a project deadline is looming. Whatever the case, you need a way to move things along quickly, without breaking governance rules.

SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud already gives us a pretty solid workflow framework for PRs. The catch, though, is that the standard setup doesn‚Äôt always capture those urgent, real-life situations. And that‚Äôs exactly where extensibility comes into play.

This blog shows you how to extend the workflow by adding a custom condition called ‚ÄúUrgent Purchasing.‚Äù With this in place, whenever a PR item is marked as urgent, the system knows to push it straight to the right approvers‚Äîhelping you strike that tricky balance between speed and control.

Business Requirement:

  • Create a new Purchase Requisition (PR) approval workflow for Urgent Purchasing line items
  • Trigger the PR workflow only when this condition is true
  • Keep it flexible so it can be reused or adapted later

    Process Flow Approach:

    To meet this requirement, the standard extensibility options in SAP S/4HANA Cloud are utilized:

    • Custom Field ‚Üí A checkbox field at the PR item level to flag whether it‚Äôs ‚ÄúUrgent Purchasing‚Äù
    • Custom Logic ‚Üí To define and evaluate the start condition for the workflow
    • Manage Workflows for Purchase Requisition App ‚Üí To configure the condition into the workflow

      Step 1: Creation of Custom Field for Purchase Requisitions:

      Created a custom field for PR items using the Custom Fields app.

      Process:

      • Go to Custom Fields ‚Üí click + (Create)
      • Fill in the following:
        • Business Context: Procurement: Purchase Requisition Item (MM_PURREQN_ITEM)
        • Label: Urgent Purchasing
        • Identifier: UrgentPurchasing
        • Tooltip: Urgent Purchasing
        • Type: Checkbox

          After creation, the relevant UIs, reports, and analytics are enabled. The new field is added to the UI by adapting the screen and adding the new field.
          Adding and Verifying the Custom Field in Purchase Requisition:

          Click on  Adapt UI  ‚Üí Add the Custom Field  ‚ÜíVerify the Custom Field ‚ÄúUrgent Purchasing‚Äù. 

          Step 2: Adding ‚ÄúUrgent Purchasing‚Äù As a Start Condition to the Workflow for Purchase Requisition: This step defines the 'Urgent Purchasing' condition, so that it appears as a start condition in the workflow configuration.

          Creating Custom logic for the ‚ÄúUrgent Purchasing‚Äù as below: 

          1. Process Flow: Go to Custom Logic App ‚Üí Click on Create ‚Üí Enter the Following Information.
          2. Business Context: Procurement: Start and Pre-Conditions in Flexible Workflow
          3. Extension Point:  SWF_WORKFLOW_CONDITION_DEF

            Click on Step 2

            1. Click on the Add Button:
